fields.value: Data, Stimuli, and Procedures for Plebanek & Sloutsky's Psychological Science article "Costs of Selective Attention: When Children Notice what Adults Miss"

dsDescriptionValue.value: The deposited contains data, stimuli, and and procedure information and ReadMe files for Plebanek & Sloutsky's Psychological Science article "Costs of Selective Attention: When Children Notice what Adults Miss".

fields.value: Note that this is Version 4.0 of the Dataverse. All the changes from Version 1 to Version 2 were made at the request of the Editor of Psychological Science prior to the publication of the paper. The changes pertain to improving the clarity of downloading and file opening instructions. There are two files in this Dataverse: (1) ReadMe_Downloading Instructions.rtf and (2) Data and Materials.txt. Please read note for each file before attempting to open the files. Several additional changes were made in Version 3 created on 4/24/2017. These changes are precipitated by the following developments. After publishing the paper, we discovered a minor error in A’ calculations that resulted in barely noticeable errors in reported A’ values. To address this issue, we posted a new table of A-prime values (one tab for Experiment 1 and another for Experiment 2). As shown in the table, although some statistical terms, p-values, and effect sizes changed, these changes are exceedingly small, with none of the reported effects getting weaker as a result of these changes. Our decision to publish these errata is driven by the desire to avoid confusion if our data are re-analyzed. Version 4.0 was created on 4/29/2017. We discovered that (1) in the raw data file two (out of 1120) trials were mislabeled and (2) one participant’s subject number did not match between different phases of the experiment (we would like to thank Dr. John Christie of Dalhousie University for noticing these errors). To address this, we had to go back to individual subject’s files and fix these errors manually. We therefore, added the corrected data file to Version 4.0 (without replacing the original data file).

files.description: This is a ReadMe file. Please download it and open with a text editor or MS Word before opening the second file. This file contains instructions as to how to open the second file.
files.label: 1. ReadMe_Downloading Instructions.rtf

dataFile.description: This is a ReadMe file. Please download it and open with a text editor or MS Word before opening the second file. This file contains instructions as to how to open the second file.

files.description: This is an archive file containing, data, stimuli, and experimental scripts. The archive has multiple folders. Please download it and, before opening it, read the ReadMe_Downloading Instructions.rtf file  for opening instruction. Note that this file will NOT open if you do not follow the opening instruction.
files.label: 2. Data and Materials.txt

dataFile.description: This is an archive file containing, data, stimuli, and experimental scripts. The archive has multiple folders. Please download it and, before opening it, read the ReadMe_Downloading Instructions.rtf file  for opening instruction. Note that this file will NOT open if you do not follow the opening instruction.

files.description: These is an excel file, presenting minor corrections to the original values of A-primes. The file was released in Version 3.0 on 4/24/2017 and updated in Version 4.0 on 4/29/2017.
files.label: Corrected_APrimes-4-28-2017.tab

dataFile.description: These is an excel file, presenting minor corrections to the original values of A-primes. The file was released in Version 3.0 on 4/24/2017 and updated in Version 4.0 on 4/29/2017.

files.description: This is a word file with the table presenting the published and corrected statistics. Although some statistical terms, p-values, and effect sizes changed, these changes are exceedingly small, with none of the reported effects getting weaker as a result of these changes. Our decision to publish these errata is driven by the desire to avoid confusion if our data are re-analyzed. The Table was released in Version 3.0 on 4/24/2017 and updated in Version 4.0 on 4/29/2017.
files.label: Corrected Stats Table 4-28-2017.docx

dataFile.description: This is a word file with the table presenting the published and corrected statistics. Although some statistical terms, p-values, and effect sizes changed, these changes are exceedingly small, with none of the reported effects getting weaker as a result of these changes. Our decision to publish these errata is driven by the desire to avoid confusion if our data are re-analyzed. The Table was released in Version 3.0 on 4/24/2017 and updated in Version 4.0 on 4/29/2017.

files.description: This is an excel file, presenting minor corrections to the original raw data and the same corrections to A-prime values as in file Corrected_APrimes-4-28-2017.tab. This file was released in Version 4.0 on 4/29/207. We added this corrected data file without replacing the original data file. This file (rather than the original data file) should be used for re-analyses of our data.
files.label: Data_All_Corrected_4-28-2017.tab

dataFile.description: This is an excel file, presenting minor corrections to the original raw data and the same corrections to A-prime values as in file Corrected_APrimes-4-28-2017.tab. This file was released in Version 4.0 on 4/29/207. We added this corrected data file without replacing the original data file. This file (rather than the original data file) should be used for re-analyses of our data.
